newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Stg/dlr uptrend intact, eyes $1.6507.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Stg/dlr uptrend intact, eyes $1.6507.

text.p: Cable is setting its sights on $1.6507 as the dollar reamins under pressure from weak U.S. asset markets, with a push above this setting up a move to the $1.6625-30 area, analysts said.

The $1.6507 level represents a 50 percent retracement of the move from December 31, 1996 peak of $1.7163 to the March 17, 1997 low of $1.5850. Next 61.8 percent Fibonacci retracement level of $1.6661 targetted after a break above $1.6507.
"The cable chart would only really turn bearish if it broke below the 38.2 percent Fibonacci retracement level ($1.6352) of the December to March decline," said one technical analyst.
Sterling/mark also looks bullish near term with the extension of the recovery from 2.6580 getting above 2.7480-7500 resistance.
This sets up a possible near-term move to the March highs of 2.7730-40 but a move below last week's lows around 2.7300 could set up a correction back to the 2.7100 area.
2.7100, trendline support dating back to March 18
1.6450, medium-term resistance dating back to early Feb
RSI - 14 day: Stg/mark: 54 pct, Stg/dollar: 64 pct
